main event: A graduate student at the University of North Dakota spotted a bright orange, circular-shaped object climbing rapidly and disappearing into heavy cloud cover over the Lower Souris Wildlife Refuge in North Dakota on July 11, 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed to climb slowly, and the lights on the object appeared to blink.
The brightness and speed of the flight of the object were the notable characteristics.
The object was observed at an elevation of 5-10 degrees and an azimuth of 270 degrees.
The sighting lasted for 1 to 1.5 minutes.
The witness, a graduate student, reported the sighting to the Grand Forks Air Force Base and later returned to the area to conduct a study for his graduate degree.
location: Lower Souris Wildlife Refuge, North Dakota
witnesses: graduate student at the University of North Dakota
